alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey; Jones; Lyman; Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 29 at 1:42AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Today will be a day of contrasts. Central South Dakota will experience dry and windy conditions, with winds out of the north to northwest at 25 to 35 mph with gusts nearing 45 mph at times. These winds will moderate as they move into eastern South Dakota during the day. While fire weather will be a concern over portions of central South Dakota, off and on rain showers will set up over eastern South Dakota and western Minnesota, with around a 60 percent chance of measurable precipitation. Another round of stronger winds out of the north to northwest can be expected during the day Sunday and again Monday afternoon across eastern portions of South Dakota, where gusts near 40 mph are expected. Relative humidity values Sunday will range from around 25 percent west of the Missouri River to 40 to 50 percent over northeastern South Dakota and western Minnesota. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. The outlook for Sunday afternoon...The grassland fire danger index will reach the moderate to high category.
